entry.title: Run .bash_profile automatically
entry.content:
For most UNIX and UNIX-based operating systems, it is common behavior to execute the file .bash_profile when opening a new Terminal session. Unfortunately, this is not the case with Xubuntu (and probably other -buntus). A fix can be found below.

Open Terminal and go to the Preferences menu under Edit. Under the General tab, you will find a checkbox named "Run command as login shell". Make sure, the box is checked. .bash_profile will then be run automatically every time you open a Terminal window.

entry.title: Transparent background for icons
entry.content:
